intro: Alloeochaete andongensis, commonly known as the Andong alloeochaete, is a flowering plant species native to Korea. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive foliage and floral structure. The plant typically features lance-shaped leaves with a smooth surface and clusters of small, tubular flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its unique botanical features, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
